attributes.action: Change the law on malicious, false reports to NSPCC
attributes.additional_details:
In December I was the subject of a vile, malicious report to NSPCC. They forwarded this false report to social services who spent time investigating. This report was total fallacy, all professionals were disgusted and relayed that I'm a great mum. 

NSPCC refuse to place a warning about making these calls and protect the rights of the "informant" over the innocent families. 

We need: 

> laws to change with regards to malicious, false reports.

> a deterrent to prevent this type of report.
attributes.background:
Anyone can contact NSPCC make up lies and this will be taken seriously.

The NSPCC refuse to place a warning at the start of a report to warn that malicious acts will result in legal action.

They refuse to chase up these reports once proven to be lies. This needs to change.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what changes you'd like to be made to the law.
